discovery_rule.name: OSPF Interfaces
discovery_rule.description: OSPF-MIB::ospfIfIpAddress The IP address of this OSPF interface.

trigger_prototype.name: OSPF Interface "{#SNMPVALUE}" State has been changed

discovery_rule.name: OSPF Neighbors
discovery_rule.description: OSPF-MIB::ospfNbrIpAddr The IP address this neighbor is using in its IP source address. Note that, on addressless links, this will not be 0.0.0.0 but the address of another of the neighbor's interfaces.

discovery_rule.name: Flash Devices
discovery_rule.description: CISCO-FLASH-MIB::ciscoFlashDeviceDescr Description of a Flash device. The description is meant to explain what the Flash device and its purpose is. Current values are: System flash - for the primary Flash used to store full system images. Boot flash - for the secondary Flash used to store bootstrap images. The device description will always be available for a removable device, even when the device has been removed.

item_prototype.name: Size of Flash Device "$1"
item_prototype.description: CISCO-FLASH-MIB::ciscoFlashDeviceSizeExtended Total size of the Flash device. For a removable device, the size will be zero if the device has been removed. This object is a 64-bit version of ciscoFlashDeviceSize.

discovery_rule.name: Memory Pool
discovery_rule.description: CISCO-MEMORY-POOL-MIB::ciscoMemoryPoolName A textual name assigned to the memory pool.

item_prototype.name: Free memory on Memory Pool "$1"
item_prototype.description: CISCO-MEMORY-POOL-MIB::ciscoMemoryPoolFree Indicates the number of bytes from the memory pool that are currently unused on the managed device.

item_prototype.name: Name of Memory Pool "$1"
item_prototype.description: CISCO-MEMORY-POOL-MIB::ciscoMemoryPoolName A textual name assigned to the memory pool.

item_prototype.name: Used memory on Memory Pool "$1"
item_prototype.description: CISCO-MEMORY-POOL-MIB::ciscoMemoryPoolUsed Indicates the number of bytes from the memory pool that are currently in use by applications on the managed device.

discovery_rule.name: CPU
discovery_rule.description: CISCO-PROCESS-MIB::cpmCPUTotalPhysicalIndex The entPhysicalIndex of the physical entity for which the CPU statistics in this entry are maintained. The physical entity can be a CPU chip, a group of CPUs, a CPU card etc. The exact type of this entity is described by its entPhysicalVendorType value. If the CPU statistics in this entry correspond to more than one physical entity (or to no physical entity), or if the entPhysicalTable is not supported on the SNMP agent, the value of this object must be zero.

item_prototype.name: CPU #$1 Usage 1min Rev
item_prototype.description: CISCO-PROCESS-MIB::cpmCPUTotal1minRev The overall CPU busy percentage in the last 1 minute period. This object deprecates the object cpmCPUTotal1min and increases the value range to (0..100).

item_prototype.name: CPU #$1 Usage 5min Rev
item_prototype.description: CISCO-PROCESS-MIB::cpmCPUTotal5minRev The overall CPU busy percentage in the last 5 minute period. This object deprecates the object cpmCPUTotal5min and increases the value range to (0..100).

item_prototype.name: CPU #$1 Usage 5sec Rev
item_prototype.description: CISCO-PROCESS-MIB::cpmCPUTotal5secRev The overall CPU busy percentage in the last 5 second period. This object deprecates the object cpmCPUTotal5sec and increases the value range to (0..100). This object is deprecated by cpmCPUTotalMonIntervalValue.

discovery_rule.name: $1 Sensors
discovery_rule.description: The textual name of the physical entity.

item_prototype.name: Status of $2 Sensor "$1"
item_prototype.description: CISCO-ENTITY-SENSOR-MIB::entSensorStatus This variable indicates the present operational status of the sensor.

trigger_prototype.name: Status of Optic Power Sensor "{#SNMPVALUE}" is nonoperational
Status of Optic Power Sensor "{#SNMPVALUE}" is unavailable

item_prototype.name: Value of $2 Sensor "$1"
item_prototype.description: CISCO-ENTITY-SENSOR-MIB::entSensorValue This variable reports the most recent measurement seen by the sensor.

discovery_rule.name: $1 Sensors
discovery_rule.description: The textual name of the physical entity.

item_prototype.name: Current Supplied by $2 "$1"
item_prototype.description: CISCO-ENTITY-FRU-CONTROL-MIB::cefcFRUCurrent Current supplied by the FRU (positive values) or current required to operate the FRU (negative values).

item_prototype.name: Operational Status of $2 "$1"
item_prototype.description: CISCO-ENTITY-FRU-CONTROL-MIB::cefcFRUPowerOperStatus Operational FRU power state.

trigger_prototype.name: Connector rating exceeded on Power Supply "{#SNMPVALUE}"
Cooling capacity is insufficient on Power Supply "{#SNMPVALUE}"
System power is insufficient on Power Supply "{#SNMPVALUE}"

item_prototype.name: Manufacturer of $2 "$1"
item_prototype.description: ENTITY-MIB::entPhysicalMfgName The name of the manufacturer of this physical component. The preferred value is the manufacturer name string actually printed on the component itself (if present).

item_prototype.name: Model Name of $2 "$1"
item_prototype.description: ENTITY-MIB::entPhysicalModelName The vendor-specific model name identifier string associated with this physical component. The preferred value is the customer-visible part number, which may be printed on the component itself.

item_prototype.name: Serial Number of $2 "$1"
item_prototype.description: ENTITY-MIB::entPhysicalSerialNum The vendor-specific serial number string for the physical entity. The preferred value is the serial number string actually printed on the component itself (if present).

discovery_rule.name: $1 Sensors
discovery_rule.description: The textual name of the physical entity.

item_prototype.name: Status of $2 Sensor "$1"
item_prototype.description: CISCO-ENTITY-SENSOR-MIB::entSensorStatus This variable indicates the present operational status of the sensor.

item_prototype.name: $2 of Sensor "$1"
item_prototype.description: CISCO-ENTITY-SENSOR-MIB::entSensorValue This variable reports the most recent measurement seen by the sensor.

item_prototype.name: Serial Number of $2 "$1"
item_prototype.description: ENTITY-MIB::entPhysicalSerialNum The vendor-specific serial number string for the physical entity. The preferred value is the serial number string actually printed on the component itself (if present).

item_prototype.name: Operational Status of $2 "$1"
item_prototype.description: ENTITY-STATE-MIB::entStateOper The operational state for this entity.

item.name: BGP Peer State
item.description: BGP4-MIB::bgpPeerState CISCO-BGP4-MIB::cbgpPeer2State The BGP peer connection state.

item.name: Attack Filter changes
item.description: The system generates this notification to indicate that the cscaFilterStatus of the attack filter for cscaType has changed due to the reason determined by cscaDescription. The system limits the generation of this notifications for the same cscaType to a five-second interval.

item.name: OSPF neighbour state
item.description: 1 : down 2 : attempt 3 : init 4 : twoWay 5 : exchangeStart 6 : exchange 7 : loading 8 : full
